intro: Nonea turcomanica, commonly known as the Turcoman sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features a sprawling growth habit with numerous small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, arranged in clusters along the stems. Nonea turcomanica is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in desert or steppe regions.
